item.title: Henrik Oppermann and Tim Summers with Reflek Music (Vision Pros - 0042)
item.itunes:title: Henrik Oppermann and Tim Summers with Reflek Music (Vision Pros - 0042)
item.description:
Henrik Oppermann and Tim Summers from Reflek Music join the podcast to discuss their app, the Mahler Chamber Orchestra. This app uses an innovative point cloud system that lets you walk around a performance enabling you to stick your head inside a cello and experience music in a whole new way.


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links: 

https://www.reflektmusic.com

http://www.schallgeber.com/ 

https://www.mahlerchamber.com/play/immersive-experiences

item.itunes:title: GlanceBar 2 with Adam Shaw (Vision Pros - 0041)
item.description:
Adam Shaw is the developer of GlanceBar, your ultimate companion for staying updated on your day's essentials. Built from the ground up for visionOS, GlanceBar consolidates crucial information into a single, easily accessible window bar.

item.title: Practicing Law with Jeff Richardson (Vision Pros - 0039)
item.itunes:title: Practicing Law with Jeff Richardson (Vision Pros - 0039)
item.description:
Jeff Richardson is an attorney practicing law in New Orleans at the office of Adams and Reese LLP. His practice areas include appellate litigation and representing defendants in class actions and complex litigation. He is an Appellate Practice Specialist, certified by the Louisiana Board of Legal Specialization, and is currently one of only 13 attorneys in Louisiana with that certification and has been practicing law since 1994.


We discuss how the Apple Vision Pro has been incorporated into his work. We also chat a fair bit about impressive photo and video apps for visionOS.


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links: 

https://www.inthenewspodcast.com

https://www.iphonejd.com

https://ipadpros.net/2024/08/01/how-attorneys-use-the-ipad-with-jeff-richardson-ipad-pros-0203/

item.title: Sessions on Prima Immersive with Tom Rettig (Vision Pros - 0037)
item.itunes:title: Sessions on Prima Immersive with Tom Rettig (Vision Pros - 0037)
item.description:
Tom Rettig is the Founder and Executive Producer at The Spatialists. He leads the creative, operational, and business direction, producing immersive video experiences for the Apple Vision Pro. 


The Spatialists are a California Bay Area studio producing immersive audio-visual content that focuses on creating high-quality immersive videos, including Sessions, a music series for the Apple Vision Pro, providing an intimate, up close experience of exceptional acoustic performances. 


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links: 

- https://www.thespatialists.net

- https://www.immersivecompany.com/

- https://apps.apple.com/us/app/prima-immersive/id6740540865

He leads the creative, operational, and business direction, producing immersive video experiences for the Apple Vision Pro.  The Spatialists are a California Bay Area studio producing immersive audio-visual content that focuses on creating high-quality immersive videos, including Sessions, a music series for the Apple Vision Pro, providing an intimate, up close experience of exceptional acoustic performances.  Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon.  Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts! Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm. item.title: Table Space with Ethan Sherbondy (Vision Pros - 0036)
item.itunes:title: Table Space with Ethan Sherbondy (Vision Pros - 0036)
item.description:
Ethan Sherbondy is the Co-Founder & CEO at Boxtree: making mixed reality magic happen. He was last on this podcast in April 2024 for episode 13. 


Boxtreeâs latest app is Table Space; a new sandbox where your favorite tabletop games come to life! Play classic games like Texas Hold'em Poker, Hanafuda, Tarot, Trading Card Games, or any card game imaginable with friends in a fully immersive environment. 


In this episode, we dive into the development scene, visionOS 2.4, API advancements with visionOS 2, and dive deep into Table Space. 


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.

item.title: Apple Vision Pro Anniversary with Wes Hilliard (Vision Pros - 0034)
item.itunes:title: Apple Vision Pro Anniversary with Wes Hilliard (Vision Pros - 0034)
item.description:
The Apple Vision Pro was released on February 2nd, 2024. A full calendar year has now passed and to join me to discuss Vision Proâs first year is Wes Hilliard from Apple Insider. Wes joined me a year ago to discuss our first 72 hours with the headset and is back to dive into the first full year. We also dive into Android XR, the Mac mini, VR gaming, and a few other random topics. 


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.

item.title: PulseJet Studios with John Gearty (Vision Pros - 0033)
item.itunes:title: PulseJet Studios with John Gearty (Vision Pros - 0033)
item.description:
John Gearty has 25 years in the VR industry and spent a decade at Apple that includes helping to create the Apple Vision Pro. In this episode, we discuss his background and dive into what he is currently doing as the founder and president of PulseJet Studios. PulseJet is an app that publishes 360 degree VR music videos and concerts. PulseJet works with musicians to create immersive videos and provides a place to experience them in the Apple Vision Pro. 


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links: 

https://www.pulsejetstudios.com/

https://scaniverse.com

item.itunes:title: Year One and the Enterprise with Oliver Weidlich (Vision Pros - 0030)
item.description:
Oliver Weidlich from Contxtual is back on the show. He was previously on episode 7 of the podcast. This time we discuss the major highlights for visionOS and the Apple Vision Pro from the last time we spoke in December of 2023 and how visionOS and the Apple Vision Pro are being utilized in the enterprise world. 


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!

item.title: ShaderVision with Clement Boissiere (Vision Pros - 0029)
item.itunes:title: ShaderVision with Clement Boissiere (Vision Pros - 0029)
item.description:
Clement Boissiere worked at Apple on the team that created the Apple Vision Pro and went on to work at Meta then TikTok. He is now running his own studio entitled Subjective Experience Studio. 


In this episode, we dive into his background at those bigger companies and discuss at length ShaderVision. ShaderVision is a real-time GPU shader editor for Spatial Computing, a live-coding tool for immersive prototyping and creative coding.


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links: 

https://sxp.studio

https://shader.vision

https://pulsargeist.com

https://x.com/sxpstudio

item.title: Santiago Hervella (Vision Pros - 0028)
item.itunes:title: Santiago Hervella (Vision Pros - 0028)
item.description:
Santiago Hervella is a developer in New York City. In this episode, we discuss visionOS 2.2, comfort mods, traveling with Apple Vision Pro, accessibility options, some powerful Shortcuts, other headsets, joining work calls in a Persona, and his launch experience in NYC.


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links: 

https://www.reliefband.com/

https://www.santiago.nyc

https://www.instagram.com/adultfantasynovel/


### Other devices


SimulaVR (Linux computer that can also be used as a headset):

https://simulavr.com/


XReal glasses:

https://www.amazon.com/Glasses-Display-Cinematic-All-Day-Comfort-Compatible/dp/B0CHVQWW4P


Viture glasses:

https://www.amazon.com/VITURE-Pro-XR-Glasses-Electrochromic/dp/B0D3LRH8G4


### Comfort Mods:


Santiago's daily driver comfort mod, CMA1 from Globular Cluster:

https://www.amazon.com/Globular-Cluster-CMA1-Comfort-Compatible/dp/B0CY25S7MN


SoloTop:

https://www.etsy.com/listing/1662062088/solotop-for-apple-vision-pro-modern-solo


Belkin Head Strap:

https://www.apple.com/shop/product/HRYW2ZM/A/belkin-head-strap-for-apple-vision-pro


Spigen Head Strap:

https://www.amazon.com/Spigen-Padded-Designed-Vision-HeadStrap/dp/B0CNG5NJK8


New ANNAPRO A2 comfort mod briefly mentioned that got delivered mid show:

https://annapro.com/products/comfort-head-strap-2-for-apple-vision-pro


### Travel:


Belkin Travel Bag:

https://www.apple.com/shop/product/HRYV2ZM/A/belkin-travel-bag-for-apple-vision-pro


3D printed travel protection from Moog's Geert Bevin:

https://www.printables.com/model/870502-the-missing-minimal-vision-pro-case-with-airtag-su


### Accessibility:


Adjust colors and contrast on Apple Vision Pro:

https://support.apple.com/guide/apple-vision-pro/colors-and-contrast-tandd53c64c3/visionos


Assistive Touch on Apple Vision Pro:

https://support.apple.com/guide/apple-vision-pro/use-assistivetouch-tan4ddb28816/visionos


### visionOS 3 wishes:


Apple quietly cut the Open Sky Environment feature they showed at the WWDC Vision Pro announcement:

https://x.com/M1Astra/status/1746329014375993608


### Apps:


Persona Webcam:

https://apps.apple.com/us/app/persona-webcam-virtual-camera/id6498891868


Instant Bar:

https://apps.apple.com/us/app/instant-bar-widgets-and-apps/id6478123838


GlaceBar:

https://apps.apple.com/us/app/glancebar-perfect-status-bar/id6477764879

item.itunes:title: Spatial Computing with Devon Dundee (Vision Pros - 0021)
item.description:
Devon Dundee is a church creative media director, blogger, podcaster, techie, and new dad. He is the co-host of the Magic Rays of Light Podcast and works for MacStories. Devon is one of the few people that primarily uses the Apple Vision Pro as a spatial computer rather than an entertainment device. In this episode we dive into all of his various workflows and apps he loves in visionOS.

item.title: Justin Searls from Breaking Change (Vision Pros - 0019)
item.itunes:title: Justin Searls from Breaking Change (Vision Pros - 0019)
item.description:
Justin Searls is a developer and the co-founder of Test Double. You can find his writing at justin.searls.co. You can listen to him on his podcast, Breaking Change. In this episode we dive into his experiences with the Xreal glasses, how the Mac integration in visionOS may long term hamper the Apple Vision Pro, the new APIs in visionOS 2 that enable camera access for enterprises, traveling with the Apple Vision Pro, and much more! 


This episode is sponsored by Agenda, the award winning app that seamlessly integrates calendar events into your note taking. Learn more at www.agenda.com. Agenda 19 is now available as a free download on visionOS, iPadOS, iOS, and macOS. 


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links:

https://justin.searls.co

https://www.xreal.com/us/

item.title: OmniFocus and OmniPlan with Ken Case (Vision Pros - 0016)
item.itunes:title: OmniFocus and OmniPlan with Ken Case (Vision Pros - 0016)
item.description:
Ken Case is the CEO of the OmniGroup and has been there as a developer for the launch of many platforms now including the Apple Vision Pro. In this episode we discuss his feelings around the launch of this new platform, making the Apple Vision Pro standard equipment at his company for every employee at the OmniGroup, and dive deep into OmniFocus for visionOS, plus we chat about OmniPlan on visionOS, and he shares some hopes for WWDC both as a user and a developer. 


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links:

https://www.omnigroup.com

https://mastodon.omnigroup.com/@OmniGroup

https://mastodon.social/@kcase

item.title: Live from VisionDevCamp with Ethan Sherbondy (Vision Pros - 0013)
item.itunes:title: Live from VisionDevCamp with Ethan Sherbondy (Vision Pros - 0013)
item.description:
Ethan Sherbondy is the developer of Mahjong Space and at work on several other visionOS apps. Mahjong Space was built with Spatial Personas in mind and is an amazing one to add to your visionOS app library if you are looking for more Spatial Persona games. 


The bulk of this episode was recorded before Apple surprise released Spatial Personas. We were able to record a special segment about Spatial Personas after Apple released that feature as a part of visionOS 1.1.


We cover a ton of ground in this episode including the community aspect of developing for visionOS. Ethan is currently at VisionDevCamp and attended both GDC and a month long visionOS developer residency where he was able to collaborate with other visionOS developers during the launch month of this new platform. 


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon.


Early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts! Subscribe today to get early access to both Vision Pros and iPad Pros!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.

item.title: Flights, Hospitals, and Entertainment with Sigmund Judge (Vision Pros - 0010)
item.itunes:title: Flights, Hospitals, and Entertainment with Sigmund Judge (Vision Pros - 0010)
item.description:
Sigmund Judge began his Apple TV coverage in 2015, and has gone on to cover Apple, tvOS, and Apple Originals across video, written articles, and podcasts. Inspired by storytellers and innovators, Sigmund is also the co-host of Magic Rays of Light, a weekly podcast exploring the diverse world of Apple TV. Sigmund is based in England and flew to Cupertino for the launch of the Apple Vision Pro. 


In this episode we discuss his time with the Apple Vision Pro including his flight back to England with the headset. We also discuss using Apple Vision Pro in a hospital environment with limited hand mobility. There is also great discussion on using the Apple Vision Pro as an entertainment device and what some of the best experiences are so far!


Bonus content and early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon. 


Bonus content and early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.


Links: 

https://mastodon.screentimes.net/@sigmund

https://www.macstories.net/author/sigjudge/

https://www.macstories.net/magic-rays-of-light/

Inspired by storytellers and innovators, Sigmund is also the co-host of Magic Rays of Light, a weekly podcast exploring the diverse world of Apple TV. Sigmund is based in England and flew to Cupertino for the launch of the Apple Vision Pro.  In this episode we discuss his time with the Apple Vision Pro including his flight back to England with the headset. We also discuss using Apple Vision Pro in a hospital environment with limited hand mobility. There is also great discussion on using the Apple Vision Pro as an entertainment device and what some of the best experiences are so far! Bonus content and early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon.  Bonus content and early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts! Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm. item.itunes:title: 72 Hours with Apple Vision Pro with Wes Hilliard (Vision Pros - 0008)
item.description:
Apple Vision Pro is here! Wes Hilliard from Apple Insider joins the podcast to discuss his time with the headset so far.


Make sure to check out Wesâs review on Apple Insider: https://appleinsider.com/articles/24/02/08/apple-vision-pro-early-review-a-peek-into-the-future-of-computing


This episode was recorded with Personas using StreamYard in Safari on visionOS. You can watch that at YouTube.com/@iPadProsPodcast where the core unedited interview is. We did each record our audio on local separate mics that you will hear in this audio version. The video version we used AirPod Pros to capture our audio; so you can hear the difference there if you are curious.


Early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon.

item.title: Oliver Weidlich from Contxtual (Vision Pros - 0007)
item.itunes:title: Oliver Weidlich from Contxtual (Vision Pros - 0007)
item.description:
Note: This episode was recorded before Apple announced the preorder and launch details of Apple Vision Pro. 


Oliver Weidlich is Director of Design and Innovation at Contxtual. We discuss his design work in spatial computing that predates Appleâs unveiling of visionOS by several years. We also dive into his experiences with other headsets including the HoloLens and the Magic Leap 1/2. 


This episode is sponsored by Glisten. Glisten is the "Good Listen" podcast app for Language Learners. It's all you need to immerse yourself in a language, on the path to becoming fluent. Learn more at www.glisten.ist. Download Glisten now for iPad, iPhone, and Apple Watch. 


Bonus content and early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon.


Bonus content and early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts! Subscribe today to get instant access to iPad Possibilities, iPad Ponderings, and iPad Historia!


Show notes are available at www.VisionPros.fm. Feedback is welcomed at tim@visionpros.fm.

item.title: James Swiney from Pixel Art Games (Vision Pros - 0006)
item.itunes:title: James Swiney from Pixel Art Games (Vision Pros - 0006)
item.description:
James Swiney from Pixel Art Games is hard at work bringing Void-X to the Apple Vision Pro. Void-X is out now for iOS and Apple Watch if youâd like to try it out before it launches next year on visionOS. We cover a ton of ground in this episode about gamingâs potential on visionOS, developing games for visionOS, is SpriteKit actually supported, launching a visionOS app from Australia (where Apple Vision Pro wonât be available), and much more!


This episode of Vision Pros is sponsored by Agenda, the award winning app that seamlessly integrates calendar events into your note taking. Learn more at www.agenda.com. Agenda 18 is now available as a free download for macOS, iPadOS, and iOS.


Bonus content and early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon.

item.title: Apple Vision Pro Labs and Symbolsaurus with Clarko (Vision Pros - 0005)
item.itunes:title: Apple Vision Pro Labs and Symbolsaurus with Clarko (Vision Pros - 0005)
item.description:
Clarko is the developer of Symbolsaurus and is fresh off his experience with the Apple Vision Pro at one of the many developer labs. As you can imagine those labs are not for public discourse, but as you can tell by the runtime of this episode that does not stop us from diving deep into the potential for visionOS and how we see spatial computing changing how we work. We also discuss at length his app Symbolsaurus that he is in the process of porting to visionOS.


This episode of iPad Pros is sponsored by Agenda, the award winning app that seamlessly integrates calendar events into your note taking. Learn more at www.agenda.com. Agenda 18 is now available as a free download for macOS, iPadOS, and iOS.


Bonus content and early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.visionpros.fm/patreon/.

item.itunes:title: Infinity Screen with Bart Busschots (Vision Pros - 0004)
item.description:
Bart Busschots is the host of Letâs Talk Apple and Letâs Talk Photography. He is also a bi-weekly contributor to the âChit-Chat Across the Pondâ segment on the NosillaCast. In this episode we discuss how the Apple Vision Pro is different from other headsets, the concept of the âinfinity screenâ, paradigm leaps, how he believes he will use the Apple Vision Pro, and much more. 


This episode of Vision Pros is sponsored by Agenda, the award winning app that seamlessly integrates calendar events into your note taking. Learn more at www.agenda.com. Agenda 18 is now available as a free download for macOS, iPadOS, and iOS.

item.itunes:title: visionOS and Platforms Launches with Ken Case (Vision Pros - 0003)
item.description:
Ken Case is the CEO of the OmniGroup and has been there as a developer for the launch of many platforms including the iPhone, iPad, and Mac OS X. In this episode we dive into Kenâs thoughts on visionOS, Apple Vision Pro, and headsets in general. We also reflect on some past platform launches and how that might relate to the future of visionOS.

item.title: Crouton with Devin Davies (Vision Pros - 0002)
item.itunes:title: Crouton with Devin Davies (Vision Pros - 0002)
item.description:
Devin Davies is the developer behind the awesome recipe organizer and meal planner app Crouton. He is already hard at work at adapting his iPad version of the app to visionOS and discovering some cool concepts like floating timers that you can place on the item you are cooking.

item.title: Trying Apple Vision Pro with Chance Miller (Vision Pros - 0001)
item.itunes:title: Trying Apple Vision Pro with Chance Miller (Vision Pros - 0001)
item.description:
Chance Miller is the editor-in-chief at 9to5Mac and was one of the first people in the world to try the Apple Vision Pro. We dive into what his experience was like using visionOS and what his hopes are for his own uses when Apple Vision Pro launches in 2024. 


You can also hear how Chance uses the iPad Pro to get work done and his experiences with iPadOS 17 in episode 176 of the iPad Pros Podcast; available at www.iPadPros.net. 


Bonus content and early episodes with chapter markers are available by supporting the podcast at www.patreon.com/ipadpros. 


Bonus content and early episodes are also now available in Apple Podcasts! Subscribe today to get instant access to iPad Possibilities, iPad Ponderings, and iPad Historia! New episodes of the bonus shows release the first week of every month.
